result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian J Dixon was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment, or may be self employed full time.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including alcohol and drug counseling.  Do not drive unless properly licensed, must also have the approval of the agent.  Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

records.addlTxt: ***DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING.***
Sentencing hearing on July 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brian J Dixon in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Brian J Dixon in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod for Erika Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - Ct.1 - G.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - Dismissed.
BTC: PSI Ordered, Bond is revoked pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian J Dixon in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Brian J Dixon in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is waiting for a copy of the deft's driving record.
Def is requesting a 60 day adjournment.
State has extended an offer.
BTC: adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

***AMENDED COMPLAINT ATTACHED***
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
allowing Atty German to withdraw as counsel
From ATTY German re: follow up on motion to withdraw.

Per Judge Marik, counsel can file a stip and order for the substitution of counsel (if SPD has appointed new attorney) or written confirmation from SPD that it will appoint counsel, then the order can be signed without a hearing.  Otherwise, the motion must be set for a hearing.
From Atty German re: enclosed motion to withdraw
ATTY German files motion to withdraw as counsel for defendant (defendant qualifies for SPD representation)
